Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): Enable pipe information when checkTypeOfPipes‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶=false

When `checkTypeOfPipes` is set to `false`, the configuration is meant to
ignore the signature of the pipe's `transform` method for diagnostics.
However, we still should produce some information about the pipe for the
`TemplateTypeChecker`. This change refactors the returned symbol for
pipes so that it also includes information about the pipe's class
instance as it appears in the TCB.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler-cli): Enable pipe information when checkTypeOfPipes‚Ä¶" (#39555)

Issues.Title: ngcc deep import warnings for generated types
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/compiler-cli ### Is this a regression? Probably not a regression. ### Description We have two repositories, both full of Angular libraries. Both repositories have generated typings in the root folder called `generated` which is ignored by git. Libraries from one repository depend on libraries of another (one direction only). What happens is that once we install certain library, that library expects `generated` path with typings inside. This actually works perfectly fine, but ngcc throws warning like: ``` WARNING in Entry point ‚Äòlibrary/name‚Äô contains deep imports into ‚Äòabsolute-path/generated/globalTypes.d.ts‚Äô. This is probably not a problem, but may cause the compilation of entry points to be out of order ``` Additionally we use TS Paths in order for ngcc to recognize the folder in the first place: ``` "generated/*": [ "generated/*" ], ``` I know it's possible to silence the warning with the snippet bellow, but we would have to repeat the entry for each and every library we produce. ```js // ngcc.config.js module.exports = { packages: { 'library/name': { ignorableDeepImportMatchers: [ /generated\//, ] }, }, }; ``` Another workaround would be to release `ngcc.config.js` with each library, looking like: ```js module.exports = { ignorableDeepImportMatchers: [/generated\//] }; ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction This would take a massive effort to reproduce. I will attempt on doing so if we cannot proceed verbally only. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 10.2.0
Node: 12.18.2
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 10.2.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... elements, forms, language-service, localize
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
... service-worker
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1002.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1002.0
@angular-devkit/core            10.2.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      10.2.0
@angular/cdk                    10.2.6
@angular/flex-layout            10.0.0-beta.32
@angular/material               10.2.6
@angular/pwa                    0.1002.0
@schematics/angular             10.2.0
@schematics/update              0.1002.0
ng-packagr                      10.1.2

typescript                      4.0.5

Issues.Title: Angular i18n generates one trans-unit where two are needed.
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? Never worked. ### Description When using icu for pluralisation the context of the words get lost. Some translations for the same words differ based on context. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction What you first need to know: **German / English** Person / person Personen /¬†persons Use in your project: ```html

{items.length, plural, one {Person} other {Personen}} gehen unwiderruflich verloren.

``` And somewhere else: ```html

Entferne {items.length, plural, one {Person} other {Personen}}

``` Note that the first letter of the noun is uppercase in german. No matter if it‚Äôs the beginning of a sentence or not. Generate translation files and translate them. You will get three nodes. Something linke this: ```html gehen unwiderruflich verloren. will be lost permanently. ``` ```html Entferne Remove ``` ```html {VAR_PLURAL, plural, one {Person} other {Person} } {VAR_PLURAL, plural, one { ‚ùì‚ùì‚ùì } other { ‚ùì‚ùì‚ùì } } ``` Problem: First sentence would need the translation `{VAR_PLURAL, plural, one {Person} other {Persons} }` Second sentence would need the translation `{VAR_PLURAL, plural, one {person} other {persons} }` I expected two trans-units. Something like this: ```html {items.length, plural, one {Person} other {Personen}} gehen unwiderruflich verloren. {items.length, plural, one {Person} other {Persons}} will be lost permanently. ``` and ```html Entferne {items.length, plural, one {Person} other {Personen}} Remove {items.length, plural, one {Person} other {Persons}} ``` ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.1.12
Node: 10.16.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 9.1.12
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

**Anything else relevant?** [@ocombe announced](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/25858#issuecomment-420191396) that the ivy release will fix this. But people [decided to not ship this](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/25858#issuecomment-707269234) in order to to _make Ivy more backwards compatible_.

Issues.Title: OWASP ZAP scanner show Medium risk vulnerability
Issues.Body:
Our regular security scan includes a ZAP task where we manually test our applications in the tool. We remained with one issue we can't solve in-house is with the generated vendor.js file for development builds.

Relevant report snippet:

### Alert Detail

Medium (Medium) | Application Error Disclosure
-- | --
Description | This page contains an error/warning message that may disclose sensitive information like the location of the file that produced the unhandled exception. This information can be used to launch further attacks against the web application. The alert could be a false positive if the error message is found inside a documentation page.
¬†
URL | https://dev-url/vendor-es2015.js
Method | GET
Evidence | internal error
Instances | 1
Solution | Review the source code of this page. Implement custom error pages. Consider implementing a mechanism to provide a unique error reference/identifier to the client (browser) while logging the details on the server side and not exposing them to the user.
Reference | ¬†
CWE Id | 200
WASC Id | 13
Source ID | 3

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34339979/98001180-a0f81680-1ded-11eb-88d5-a56ef991a293.png)

Do you have an idea how to work around this issue?

ZAP Version: 2.9.0 (latest)
Angular version: 8.2.14 (but the code snippet is in v11 as well)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "OWASP ZAP scanner show Medium risk vulnerability" (#39550)

Issues.Title: Reactive Forms guide could be more precise on HTML5 native validators
Issues.Body:
In the [Reactive Forms guide](https://angular.io/guide/reactive-forms), a user is encouraged to use native HTML5 attributes for validation such as `required`, `minlength` or `maxlength`. However, the default behavior of Angular reactive form is that it adds `novalidate` attribute to the form, which prevents native validators from functioning. 

To prevent misunderstanding, I would suggest adding information, that in order for HTML5 validators to work properly, one needs to add `ngNativeValidate` directive to the form.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Reactive Forms guide could be more precise on HTML5 native validators" (#39549)

Issues.Title: test(compiler-cli): Add test for checkTypeOfDomReferences = false
Issues.Body:
Add test for when `checkTypeOfDomReferences = false` to ensure that we
do not regress in behavior at any point. The desired behavior for this
case is that the `TemplateTypeChecker` will honor the user's
configuration and not produce symbols for the dom reference.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "test(compiler-cli): Add test for checkTypeOfDomReferences = false" (#39539)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): TemplateTypeChecker with checkTypeOfAttributes=false should still work
Issues.Body:
When the compiler option `checkTypeOfAttributes` is `false`, we should
still be able to produce type information from the
`TemplateTypeChecker`. The current behavior ignores all attributes that
map to directive inputs. This commit includes those attribute bindings
in the TCB but adds the "ignore for diagnostics" marker so they do not
produce errors. This way, consumers of the TTC (the Language Service)
can still get valid information about these attributes even when the
user has configured the compiler to not produce diagnostics/errors for them.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler-cli): TemplateTypeChecker with checkTypeOfAttributes=false should still work" (#39537)

Issues.Title: The keyvalue pipe does not work correctly with types. (Since v11-next.4)
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package `@angular/common` ([/src/pipes/keyvalue_pipe.ts](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/common/src/pipes/keyvalue_pipe.ts)) ### Is this a regression? The pipe from Angular version [11.0.0-next.3](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/11.0.0-next.3/packages/common/src/pipes/keyvalue_pipe.ts) works. But [11.0.0-next.4](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/11.0.0-next.4/packages/common/src/pipes/keyvalue_pipe.ts) does **not** work. I included the source code to my repository with another pipe name `mykeyvalue` and checked both versions on the latest Angular version. ### Description The `keyvalue` pipe does not work correctly with types. Since `11.0.0-next.4`. Use the `keyvalue` pipe on a property with a custom type. See my source code blocks / graphics or download the demo (see below). 2. See that all properties of `value` are marked as error. The pipe does not pass the type correctly. 3. Build it. It works. But the error in editor persists. It seems to be related to the ng extension. 4. Try restart of VS Code. Nothing helped. **Source Code** app.component.html ```html
  • {{ entry.value.text }}
``` menu-items.model.ts ```ts export interface MenuItem { text: string; } export interface Menu { [key: string]: MenuItem; } ``` Other (Snippets): ```ts // app.component.ts import { MenuService } from './menu-items/menu-items.service'; export class AppComponent { constructor(public menuService: MenuService) {} } // menu-items.service.ts import { Menu, MenuItem } from './menu-items.model'; public menu: Menu = {}; // See model (above). ``` ## üî• Exception or Error

Attaching the basic demo from Stackblitz to reproduce the issue.
Could you please check and help me to fix this.

[Angular 9 and ngx-BS 6.1.0](https://stackblitz.com/edit/ngx-bootstrap-vjan8b?file=app%2Fapp.module.ts)

Issues.Title: Self-closing component tags (<my-comp/> instead of <my-comp></my-comp>)?
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package

This feature request is for `@angular/compiler`? Unsure.

### Description

The issue title pretty much covers it but here is another example:

```HTML
<super-duper-long-component-name [prop]="someVar" />
<!-- instead of -->
<super-duper-long-component-name [prop]="someVar"></super-duper-long-component-name>
```

There is an existing issue for this, #673, but it was closed due to inactivity.

That issue got half-rejected (it was not resolved) on the basis of the HTML spec, which does not allow self-closing tags. That makes a total of **zero** sense to me. The HTML template language is already far beyond what vanilla HTML offers, and that is the entire point of using a framework like Angular. Many other major frameworks (React/Vue/Svelte to name a few) already support self-closing component tags.

I understand that Angular templates were being parsed in the browser before, but why should ease-of-life syntax sugar be banned when using AOT compilation? Sure, some people still use JIT-compiled Angular, but then again, some people still use Internet Explorer in 2020. If they want to suffer so be it but why refuse to add excellent features for the rest of us? There are plenty of antifeatures out there but I personally think self-closing tags are pretty intuitive and improve the code quality significantly; from the looks of #673 it seems like a lot of other people agree.

Please reconsider self-closing component tags.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Continue to sigh as I write needlessly verbose code and write checks for two different nullish types.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Self-closing component tags (<my-comp/> instead of <my-comp></my-comp>)?" (#39525)

Issues.Title: CLI 11.0.0-rc.1 [WDS] Disconnected! and net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED

# üêû Bug report ### Command - [ ] new - [ ] build - [X] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? HMR doesn't work. Application will not reload on recompile. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ``` ng new ng11 ? Do you want to enforce stricter type checking and stricter bundle budgets in the workspace? This setting helps improve maintainability and catch bugs ahead of time. For more information, see https://angular.io/strict No ? Would you like to add Angular routing? No ? Issues.Title: Angular 11: Material Icons are not rendered after build and they're displayed as text
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/material @angular/cli ### Is this a regression? Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: @angular/cli 10.2.0, @angular/material 10.2.6 ### Description After running `ng build --prod` and running the app from `dist` folder, the Material Icons are not rendered and they're displayed as text only. It looks like the issue is in the generated `dist/index.html` file: ```html App Title ``` In previous version, the `dist/index.html` file was generated as follows: ```html App Title ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I successfully reproduced the issue in my repo [https://github.com/luixaviles/web-speech-angular](https://github.com/luixaviles/web-speech-angular). Just follow the next steps: ``` git clone -b 11.0.0-rc.1 https://github.com/luixaviles/web-speech-angular.git npm install ng build --prod http-server dist/web-speech-angular ``` Then verify in your browser and take a look into `dist/index.html` vs `index.html` file. ## üî• Exception or Error
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 11.0.0-rc.1
Node: 12.16.1
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 11.0.0-rc.1
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1100.0-rc.1
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1100.0-rc.1
@angular-devkit/core            11.0.0-rc.1
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.0.0-rc.1
@angular/cdk                    11.0.0-rc.0
@angular/material               11.0.0-rc.0
@schematics/angular             11.0.0-rc.1
@schematics/update              0.1100.0-rc.1
rxjs                            6.5.5
typescript                      4.0.5
**Anything else relevant?** All relevant details are already described in the issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular 11: Material Icons are not rendered after build and they're displayed as text" (#19271)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-progress-spinner): prevent animation from affecting surrounding layout
Issues.Body:
Similar to #16930. Prevents the indeterminate animation from overflowing the host node and affecting the page layout.

The issue can be seen on Windows where the scroll bar is always visible.

![demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/98035418-c0f0ff80-1e18-11eb-8646-33ba5c702ced.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental/mdc-progress-spinner): prevent animation from affecting surrounding layout" (#20962)

Issues.Title: fix(material/checkbox): set display on host node
Issues.Body:
Currently the host nodes are `display: inline` by default which doesn't allow for things like `margin` and `width` to be set. These changes switch to `inline-block` which is a bit more flexible.

Fixes #20954.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/checkbox): set display on host node" (#20961)

Issues.Title: build: add CI check to ensure consistent exports for MDC packages
Issues.Body: Adds a new script that checks whether an MDC package exports the same set of symbols as its non-MDC counterpart. Also fixes all of the failures.

Issues.Title: bug(menu): matMenuTrigger not exposing menuOpen properly
Issues.Body: #### Reproduction Issue not reproducible on Stackblitz. Therefore, I opted to create this repo: https://github.com/MatLang/menuDemo. The repository contains a simple menu in a component that has its changeDetection set to OnPush. ```html ``` Steps to reproduce: 1. Clone the above repo 2. Serve the application 3. Open/Close the menu #### Expected Behavior I am expecting "up" and "down" to show up alternatively, depending on if the menu is closed or not. #### Actual Behavior The behavior is inconsistent, i.e. showing "up" and "down" in different states. #### Possible Fix Follow a more reactive approach and expose the menuState as a stream. #### Environment - Angular: ~10.2.0 - CDK/Material: ^10.2.7 - Browser(s): Chrome - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(menu): matMenuTrigger not exposing menuOpen properly" (#20959)

Issues.Title: MatCheckbox should be `display: inline-block`
Issues.Body: Currently `<mat-checkbox>` is `display: inline`. This means that things like margin, height, width, etc. won't apply to it. The element should be `display: inline-block`. The MDC version also has this problem. We may decide to only fix this in the MDC version.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatCheckbox should be `display: inline-block`" (#20954)

Issues.Title: feat(material): grid system missing in `@angular/material`
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description
Hi,
Angular material is listed for example in [this article](https://medium.com/@dharmendraoist/19-best-angular-ui-frameworks-to-use-for-faster-development-in-2020-b50e8e8c5072) as the most used and top ui lib. for angular. I personally like it üëç 

If i compare `@angular/material` to `ngx-bootstrap` or `ng-prime` or even `salesforce`. I see a missing part 'the grid system'.
bootstrap: https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/layout/grid/
prime: https://www.primefaces.org/primeng-flexgrid/
salesforce/lightning: http://www.lightningdesignsystem.com/utilities/grid/

material.io website describes a [grid system here](https://material.io/design/layout/responsive-layout-grid.html).

The request:
 If it's `@angular/flex-layout` then it should be linked in the documentation of the github repo. as official grid-system.
Or **I think personally that `@angular/material` should add it's own with css classes and not directives => like other libs do.**

side notes:
- https://blog.logrocket.com/css-grid-or-css-frameworks/
Css grid is not used everywhere. A lot incorp. are still using a grid system from css-frameworks.

- I see some teams in companies **including bootstrap only for the grid system** on top of `@angular/material`.

Thank you
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(material): grid system missing in `@angular/material`" (#20950)

Issues.Title: fix(material/chips): screen readers announcing placeholder twice in some cases
Issues.Body:
When a form field is in legacy mode and it doesn't have a label, it'll promote the input placeholder to the label which will cause screen readers to read out the same text twice. These changes clear the chip input placeholder if it's placed in such a form field, similarly to how we do it for `MatInput`.

Fixes #20761.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/chips): screen readers announcing placeholder twice in some cases" (#20945)

Issues.Title: fix(material/datepicker): range input emitters not picked up by language service
Issues.Body:
The `dateChange` and `dateInput` outputs are inherited through a mixin which seems to prevent the language service from picking them up. These changes add extra hints to the component metadata.

Fixes #20932.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/datepicker): range input emitters not picked up by language service" (#20937)

Issues.Title: fix(material/input): preserve native placeholder on non-legacy appearances
Issues.Body:
The `legacy` form field appearance has a feature where it promotes the input placeholder to the form field label which introduces a problem where screen readers will read out the placeholder twice. Some time ago we added logic to clear the placeholder, but it seems to be a bit too aggressive since it also clears the placeholder for other appearances.

These changes scope the workaround only to the case when a placeholder would be promoted to a label.

Fixes #20903.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/input): preserve native placeholder on non-legacy appearances" (#20936)
